text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to clarify that an equitable lien (a right to have a debt paid from a specific property) is a distinct remedy from a constructive trust (a right to a share of the property's ownership). The candidate answer explicitly addresses this distinction in Section 1, stating: \"Equitable remedies (constructive trust, unjust enrichment, contribution) ... do not automatically remove the lender\u2019s charge... Your constructive-trust claim will then be a right to the remainder of the equity (if any) or a right to contribute against your ex for the value you added.\" Furthermore, it contrasts the constructive trust (a right to a share/money) with the mortgage (a real right enforceable by sale). This clearly separates the nature and effect of the two remedies.", "criterion_id": "944e2205-52aa-406d-b061-82df0456fa31"}
